body_html:
I'm a bit confused about whether or not we should be looking at #5856 or this PR.

Also, the split PR https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/5856/files is still pretty big. I think a more useful (and less work for you) way to ease the PR process is to read through your diff, and write comments in English text as you read through it about various things you did. Write about anything that wouldn't be obvious to a reviewer from a casual glance, write about how you thought about the code when you were writing it.

For example, when I see a big change block in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/5856/files#diff-8189529460e7e7e3cbd932342fd61d76L20 it's not obvious to me if you were just moving code around, or if you made a substantive change. Some English text in the PR description helps me figure it out without having to jump around.

body:
I'm a bit confused about whether or not we should be looking at #5856 or this PR.

Also, the split PR https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/5856/files is still pretty big. I think a more useful (and less work for you) way to ease the PR process is to read through your diff, and write comments in English text as you read through it about various things you did. Write about anything that wouldn't be obvious to a reviewer from a casual glance, write about how you thought about the code when you were writing it.

For example, when I see a big change block in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/5856/files#diff-8189529460e7e7e3cbd932342fd61d76L20 it's not obvious to me if you were just moving code around, or if you made a substantive change. Some English text in the PR description helps me figure it out without having to jump around.
